ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about Japanese films and film studies in general
I learned about the roots and early years of Japanese Cinema.

In this course, we learned about how the Japanese film industry evolved from it's beginning until 1960. This involved analyzing Japanese films with knowledge of historical context in Japan as well as how the meaning of Japanese in "Japanese Cinema" has been understood over time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: both the professor and TA were great, it was definitely accessible to students who had no background in film and Japanese studies/language Weaknesses: speaking Japanese would be a plus but not necessary
I think it was run extremely well, I'm not sure it could be greatly improved. If anything, maybe more discussion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It was very interesting material and I feel like I learned a lot about older film in general as well as specifically Japanese film and culture at the time. Professor is great and class is good for all levels of experience.
Yes, its interesting material and professor Gerow is one of the premier scholars of the material.

Yes. If you are interested in familiarizing yourself with Japanese films and understanding Japanese history through this lens, I would recommend this class. Professor Gerow is very knowledgable about the subject of this course. Also, you get to watch great films each week and practice listening in Japanese.
